content: a really quick and easy little strap pouch for your phone that keeps your device safe and your hands free a cute gift that is super customisable in sizes yarn types colours and details notes - i recommend a durable yarn with little to no stretch i used nakyangyarn s if a sturdy cotton yarn that comes in a variety of colours and is reminiscent of thin rope in its texture - use a hook that works with your yarn of choice - the pouch is worked continuously in a spiral you can put in a marker for the beginning of the round if you want but i honestly just eyeballed it - you can use any d-rings / o-rings / hooks / whatever for vibrant accents acronyms strap h on e chain - chain by @bomstuh single_crochet - single_crochet single_crochet blo - single_crochet into the back loop only slip_stitch - slip_stitch pattern body base - work 1 single_crochet blo 1 single_crochet repeat - until the device is entirely covered when put into the pouch work 1 more round in - chain enough chain to cover the width of your device ch1 pattern more - single_crochet into 2nd chain from hook and into every chain - 2 more single_crochet into the last chain you are moving around the corner to the other side of your foundation chain - single_crochet into every chain again from the other side - 1 more single_crochet into the last chain count your single_crochet you should have finish an uneven number of single_crochet if you have an even number of stitches work 1 more single_crochet into the last chain - continue the pattern until you reach one of the sides chain 2 - and skip the 2 stitches directly at the sides continue in pattern repeat for the other side these are the holes for the hooks / carabiners / etc - work 1 more round in pattern putting two sts into the 2ch space from the round before - work 1 round in slip_stitch slip_stitch into the first slip_stitch fasten_off you can just tie the strap into a knot to make it shorter but you can t add length retroactively - put the long sides on top of each other you can try which look you prefer right side or wrong side facing outwards they re both pretty and slip_stitch the edges together i inserted my hook into the back loop of the st closest to me and the front loop of the stitch on the other edge fasten_off leaving a long-ish tail - attach the carabiner/o-ring/d-ring/hook either with the tails you left or weave in the tails trying to make both ends look similar and push the carabiner/etc through the strap that s what i did - weave in all ends - you re done wowee *** tunisian simple stitch there are a ton of tutorials out there and strap it is a fun technique to learn if you have never done tunisian crochet
